aline.description: Lucie's aunt Aline and her friend Alain are on vacation in the United State, from France. They spent an afternoon and evening in Berkeley getting to know the Mosii.
aline.title: Aline

aline2.description: Aline, Alain, Lucie, Felix and Milo.
aline2.title: Aline 2

bats.description: It's never too early to start decorating for Halloween!  Here, Felix makes bats for his bedroom.
bats.title: Bats

crissyfield1.description: We had positively perfect beautiful weather this weekend. We packed the kids, a picnic, and the sand toys off to Crissy Fields.
crissyfield1.title: Crissyfield 1

crissyfield2.description: Everyone looks good with the Golden Gate Bridge in the background.
crissyfield2.title: Crissyfield 2

crissyfield4.description: ...perhaps the convention of little fluffy white dogs. We counted 20 of them.
crissyfield4.title: Crissyfield 4

crissyfield5.description:
Flying V of pelicans.

At one point the pelicans formed a second V. Milo got very excited at the sight of a flying W (his all time favorite letter).
crissyfield5.title: Crissyfield 5

crissyfield6.description: Happiness: a bucket o' wet sand.
crissyfield6.title: Crissyfield 6

drawing.description: This is Felix's best figurative drawing to date. A real animal, complete with a body, 4 legs, a tail, a face, 2 eyes and a mouth! He says it's a "moutain climber", which is sort of like a mountain lion but mean (which is why he chose black).
drawing.title: Drawing

playdate1.description: Sofia.  She spent the night.  We had a lovely time, though Dean found there are many things that "one shouldn't do at a Lady's tea party". These include jumping like a gorilla, singing loudly, and farting.
playdate1.title: Playdate 1

playdate2.description: Flying Sofia. She was definitely pro-gorilla after the Lady's tea party.
playdate2.title: Playdate 2

remotecontrolcar.description: Espresso Roma's side patio is perfect for remote control truckin'.
remotecontrolcar.title: Remotecontrolcar

soccer1.description: Nana bought us a soccer goal.
soccer1.title: Soccer 1

description:
A lot of people say to Dean and Lucie, "Because of the website we know what's up with the kids to the last detail. But what's up with you two?" Well, here goes:

Lucie is working on redesigning SFGate, the website of San Francisco's newspaper, The Chronicle. It's fun and as part of testing the design she gets to meet many avid/rabid users of the website.

Dean's company, Widgetbox, has launched. They did a big presentation at a conference in San Diego two weeks ago that was very well received. Lots of journalists are writing and blogging about them. They're trying to keep the company small (there's only 5 employees right now), but there's pressure to get bigger faster. It's fun but time consuming.

We both feel the time crunch. Lucie fights to keep her work commitment under 20 hours a week and Dean is always home by 6:45pm, walking out of an office that's working full tilt. Especially for Lucie, small changes can have a big impact: working an extra two hours in a week often means she either misses the gym that week, misses sleep, or misses buying groceries.

Felix and Milo are the beneficiaries of Lucie's 20 hour work week: she works at New School one day a week, takes Milo to gym class and has started this week taking Felix to a class at the Lawrence Hall of Science. It's about making science-related toys. This week they made sort of a treasure hunt toy, but the coolest thing Felix discovered was the existence of wipe-off pens.
title: October 8
